title: 113_hr5402
content: The Act is titled the "Standard Merger and Acquisition Reviews Through Equal Rules Act of 2014" and includes amendments to the Clayton Act. The Clayton Act (15 U.S.C. 12 et seq.) is amended to include provisions related to the Federal Trade Commission's authority in enforcing violations of section 7. The Clayton Act is amended to include provisions related to the Federal Trade Commission's authority in enforcing violations of section 7. This includes inserting references to the Federal Trade Commission in various subsections of the Act. The Clayton Act is amended to include provisions related to the Federal Trade Commission's authority in enforcing violations of section 7, with references to the FTC inserted in various subsections of the Act. The Clayton Act is amended to include provisions related to the Federal Trade Commission's authority in enforcing violations of section 7, with references to the FTC inserted in various subsections of the Act, including sections 11, 13, and 15. Amendments are made to the Federal Trade Commission Act. Amendments to the Federal Trade Commission Act include provisions related to proposed mergers, acquisitions, and joint ventures. The Act now specifies that certain activities related to the consummation of such transactions are subject to regulation by the Commission. The Federal Trade Commission Act now allows the district courts of the United States to issue writs of mandamus to ensure compliance with the Act or Commission orders regarding proposed mergers, acquisitions, and joint ventures subject to regulation. SEC. 4. EFFECTIVE DATE; APPLICATION OF AMENDMENTS. This Act and its amendments will take effect on the enactment date, with exceptions for violations of the Clayton Act before enactment, transactions complying with the Act, and consummated mergers or acquisitions.
